description: Contradiction detection test cases for interference evaluation
notes: Each case has new_content, existing_content, similarity, and expected signal types
Categories: negation, antonym, temporal, combined, no_signal, false_positive
false_positive cases from issue #67 — known word-level antonym problems

cases.new_content: The API does not require authentication
cases.existing_content: The API requires authentication with JWT tokens

cases.new_content: Python 3.12 is not supported by this library
cases.existing_content: Python 3.12 is supported by this library

cases.new_content: The service never crashes under load
cases.existing_content: The service crashes under heavy load

cases.new_content: Dark mode is enabled by default in the settings
cases.existing_content: Dark mode is disabled by default in the settings

cases.new_content: The deployment succeeded on the production cluster
cases.existing_content: The deployment failed on the production cluster

cases.new_content: CORS is required for the API gateway
cases.existing_content: CORS is optional for the API gateway

cases.new_content: The project no longer uses Redis for caching
cases.existing_content: The project uses Redis for caching

cases.new_content: We switched from PostgreSQL to SQLite for the storage backend
The API was REST but now uses GraphQL
cases.notes: Temporal supersession with 'was X now Y'

cases.new_content: Authentication is no longer required and the endpoint is now open
cases.existing_content: Authentication is required and the endpoint is closed
cases.notes: Multiple signals: negation + antonym (required/open vs closed) + temporal

cases.new_content: The service was previously synchronous but has been updated to async
cases.existing_content: The service uses synchronous request handling

cases.new_content: The API uses FastAPI with Pydantic models
cases.existing_content: The API uses FastAPI for request handling

cases.new_content: Redis is used for session storage
cases.existing_content: Redis is used for caching frequently accessed data
cases.notes: Same technology, different use cases — not contradictions

cases.new_content: The deployment uses Docker with Alpine base images
cases.existing_content: The deployment uses Docker Compose for orchestration

cases.new_content: anthropic-lb allowed_ips configuration accepts CIDR notation for IP ranges
cases.existing_content: The firewall blocked 3 unauthorized access attempts yesterday
cases.notes: Issue #67 — 'allowed' vs 'blocked' are complementary security concepts, not contradictions

cases.new_content: The accept header must be set to application/json for API requests
cases.existing_content: The server will reject requests with invalid content types
cases.notes: Issue #67 pattern — accept/reject in different semantic contexts

cases.new_content: The open_connections metric tracks active database connections
cases.existing_content: Close idle connections after 30 seconds to prevent pool exhaustion
cases.notes: Issue #67 pattern — open/close as operational concepts, not contradictions
